subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: how to transcribe air and ear
msgSnippet: ... Exactly so. -- Long-short-short, long-short-short / Dactyls in dimeter,     John Cowan Verse form with choriambs / (Masculine rhyme):
messageBody:
Ph. D. scripsit:

> This doesn't seem much different from Spanish
> speakers learning which words use |y| and which
> use |ll| or which use |z| and which use |s|. These
> pairs are pronounced differently in some dialects,
> but are merged in others.

Exactly so.

--
Long-short-short, long-short-short / Dactyls in dimeter, John Cowan
Verse form with choriambs / (Masculine rhyme): cowan@...
One sentence (two stanzas) / Hexasyllabically
Challenges poets who / Don't have the time. --robison who's at texas dot net
